discussion.title: Forcing Real Constants in Symbolic Regression with Complex Input/Output
discussion.body:
Hi,

I'm wondering if there's a way to constrain the constants generated in the equations to be **real only**, when the input and output are complex.

For example, in the code below, the input `X` is real but cast as complex (`0im`), and the output `y` is complex. I'd like to ensure that any constants generated in the regression (i.e., at the leaves) are real numbers. It's acceptable if they appear in the form `a + b*i`, but I want to enforce that `b = 0`.

```julia
using SymbolicRegression

n = 100
X = reshape(range(0, 1, n), 1, n) .+ 0im
y = @. X + X^2 * im

options = Options(
    binary_operators=[+, *],
    unary_operators=[],
    populations=20,
    verbosity=1,
    should_simplify=true
)

hall_of_fame = equation_search(
    X, y, niterations=40, options=options,
    parallelism=:serial
)
```

Thank you for your support

nodes.body: Hi @SayyedAhmadKhadem, please see the answer here: https://github.com/MilesCranmer/PySR/discussions/768#discussioncomment-11496143
